title: Activity: Add Users to Your CRM

sections.content: To fully understand Security Control and see the difference between Admin and Standard Users, you need more than one user in your CRM that you can access and test with.
Review this resource to familiarize yourself with Roles: [Zoho CRM Help: Role Management Introduction](https://www.zoho.com/crm/help/security-control/role-management.html)
We'll cover roles in more depth later today, but you'll need to understand the basics before starting this exercise.
You'll create at least two additional users in your CRM, both with the Standard profile. This includes:

items: Creating a new role in your hierarchy
Setting up email accounts for your test users
Adding the users to your CRM
Testing their access and permissions
Open your CRM and navigate to **Setup → Security Control → Roles**
You'll see two existing roles: **CEO** and **Manager**
Create a new role beneath Manager in the hierarchy
**Suggested name:** Sales or Salesperson

sections.content: Make sure the new role reports to Manager, giving you three tiers:
Step 2: Create Email Addresses for Your Test Users

items: Create at least two free email addresses (Zoho Mail, Gmail, or similar work fine)
Write down each email and password — you'll need to log in as these users during testing
Keep these credentials somewhere organized; you'll use them throughout training

sections.content: Step 3: Add the Users to Your CRM

items: In your CRM, go to **Setup → Users → Add New User**
Enter the email addresses you just created

Assign roles like this:
  - One user under the **Manager** role
  - One user under the **Sales** role (reporting to Manager)

Assign the **Standard** profile to both users
  - You can modify their profiles later as needed

Use a different browser or browser profile (Chrome, Ulaa, Firefox, etc.) for each new user
  - This lets you stay logged in to multiple accounts at the same time without conflicts
Log in to each user's email and accept the CRM invitation
Follow the prompts to create a Zoho profile and join the CRM
Give each user a distinct name so you can easily tell them apart
Log in to the CRM as each user and confirm you can access it

sections.content: Once you're logged in as your new users, you'll probably notice they can't see any records yet. This is expected — all your Leads are currently owned by the Admin and haven't been shared.
Think back to the lesson on Profiles, Roles, and Data Sharing.
**Bonus Challenge:** Figure out on your own how to adjust sharing permissions so your new users can view or access records. What options do you have?
Before moving on, confirm you've completed the following:

items: Created a new Role (Sales or similar) that reports to Manager
Created at least 2 email addresses for test users
Added both users to your CRM with the Standard profile
Assigned one user to Manager and one to Sales
Logged in as each user and confirmed CRM access
Noticed the permission limitations for Standard users
